conditions.name: Anxiety & Stress
conditions.description: Feelings of worry, nervousness, or unease about something with an uncertain outcome. Stress response that may include racing thoughts, tension, and physical symptoms.
approaches: Nervine herbs to calm the nervous system
conditions.whenToSeek: If anxiety significantly interferes with daily life, causes panic attacks, or is accompanied by depression

conditions.name: Insomnia & Sleep Issues
conditions.description: Difficulty falling asleep, staying asleep, or waking too early. Can be occasional or chronic, often related to stress, anxiety, or poor sleep habits.
approaches: Sedative herbs taken 30-60 minutes before bed
Nervine teas to wind down in evening
conditions.whenToSeek: If insomnia persists for more than a few weeks, if accompanied by daytime impairment, or if you suspect sleep apnea

conditions.name: Indigestion & Upset Stomach
conditions.description: Discomfort in the upper abdomen including bloating, gas, nausea, or a feeling of fullness. Often related to eating too quickly, rich foods, or stress.
approaches: Carminative herbs to relieve gas and bloating
Bitter herbs before meals to stimulate digestion
conditions.whenToSeek: If symptoms persist, are severe, include vomiting blood, unexplained weight loss, or difficulty swallowing

conditions.name: Common Cold
conditions.description: Viral upper respiratory infection causing congestion, sore throat, runny nose, and general malaise. Typically lasts 7-10 days.
approaches: Immune-supporting herbs at first sign of symptoms
conditions.whenToSeek: If fever is high or prolonged, symptoms worsen after 10 days, difficulty breathing, or symptoms of secondary infection

conditions.name: Influenza (Flu)
conditions.description: More severe viral respiratory illness than a cold, with sudden onset of high fever, body aches, fatigue, and respiratory symptoms.
approaches: Elderberry to reduce duration and severity
Diaphoretic herbs to support fever response
lifestyle: Allow fever to work (unless dangerously high)
conditions.whenToSeek: Difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain, confusion, severe vomiting, high-risk groups (elderly, pregnant, immunocompromised)

conditions.name: Headache & Tension
conditions.description: Pain or discomfort in the head, often related to tension, stress, dehydration, or eye strain. Tension headaches are most common.
conditions.whenToSeek: Sudden severe headache, headache with fever and stiff neck, headache after head injury, changes in vision or speech

conditions.name: Skin Irritation & Minor Wounds
conditions.description: Minor skin issues including rashes, irritation, minor cuts, scrapes, burns, and insect bites.
approaches: Demulcent herbs to soothe and protect
conditions.whenToSeek: Signs of infection (increasing redness, pus, fever), deep wounds, burns larger than 3 inches, wounds that won't stop bleeding

conditions.name: Nausea & Motion Sickness
conditions.description: Feeling of sickness with an inclination to vomit. Can be caused by motion, pregnancy, digestive upset, or other factors.
approaches: Ginger in any form - tea, capsules, crystallized, or fresh
Small sips rather than large amounts
conditions.whenToSeek: Persistent vomiting, blood in vomit, signs of dehydration, severe abdominal pain, head injury

conditions.name: Inflammation & Pain
conditions.description: Body's response to injury or irritation, causing redness, swelling, heat, and pain. Can be acute or chronic.
approaches: Addressing root cause alongside symptom relief
conditions.whenToSeek: Severe pain, inability to move joint, signs of infection, inflammation without known cause

conditions.name: Weak Immunity
conditions.description: Tendency to catch illnesses frequently, slow recovery, or general feeling of being run down. Often related to stress, poor diet, or lack of sleep.
approaches: Deep immune tonics for chronic weakness
conditions.whenToSeek: Frequent severe infections, infections that don't respond to treatment, unexplained weight loss or fatigue
